All I can say is: awesome. I'm generally one who sticks to games I'm comfortable with (Mario, Zelda, Smash Bros., etc.), but I've heard this game was good so I gave it a try, and it was worth every penny. I will be playing this again. The intellectual challenge of it was super fun, lots of great humor mixed in with the seriousness of the situation you find yourself in, great music, very visually pleasing. Overall, absolutely excellent game, I highly recommend it.

I decided to replay [b]Portal 2[/b] after so many years and it is still such a masterpiece. It threw me back to 2011 when I first played it, ah the nostalgia.

[i]"It's been a long time, how have you been?"[/i] - GlaDOS

[b][u]Pros:[/u][/b]
- The story is awesome and well written
- The soundtrack is absolutely fantastic
- Awesome puzzles
- It's still is a very innovative game even to this day
- Voice acting is also top notch
- Lots of comedy
- Quite long [i](About 8 hours)[/i]
- The credits is so fantastic you don't want to skip it.
- Workshop support [i](Custom Test Chambers to complete)[/i]
- Coop Mode with its own storyline which is also just amazing
- Big mods have been created for the game which you can find on the Steam Store

[b][u]Cons:[/u][/b]
- Not much really

[b][u]Mod Reviews:[/u][/b]

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/TheBeggarSoldier/recommended/286080?snr=1_5_9__402]Thinking with Time Machine[/url]

[b]10/10[/b] This game will always be a masterpiece and I can recommend it totally. If you didn't play this already, just do it.

absolute banger of a game, challenging puzzles and a sweet storyline, one of the best sequels you can find. bearing in mind how small the original portal is, this is an amazing successor that goes above and beyond your expectations. co-op mode is also great fun and interesting, and is one of the better co-op modes in a game i've seen - in that you actually have to help each other and complete different challenges to progress. workshop content is also widely available and in plentiful supply, mainly thanks to the perpetual testing initiative, so this game will quite literally never grow old

overall a 10/10 from me

I really love this game great story and gameplay but i dunno what to say so here's a cake recipe:
1. Preheat oven to 180¬∞c/160¬∞c fan-forced. Grease a 20cm (6cm deep) round cake pan. Line base and side with baking paper.

2. Combine sugar, butter, cocoa, bicarbonate of soda and 1 cup water in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir for 5 minutes or until sugar dissolves. Bring to the boil then reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes, ensuring mixture does not boil over. Remove pan from heat and cool for 10 minutes.

3. Transfer mixture to a large bowl. Add eggs and stir until well combined. Add flour and, using a wooden spoon, stir until well combined. Pour into cake pan, then bake for 50 minutes or until a skewer inserted into centre comes out clean. Stand cake in pan for 10 minutes, then transfer onto a wire rack to cool.

4. To make the frosting, combine butter, caster sugar and 2 tbs water in a small saucepan, then stir over a medium heat for 4 minutes, without boiling, or until sugar dissolves. Sift icing sugar and cocoa into a small bowl. Gradually stir cocoa mixture into butter mixture until combined. Cover and refrigerate for 20 minutes or until frosting thickens. Beat with a wooden spoon until spreadable.
